author: {'steamid': '76561198069989806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1624051526}
review:
WHERE TO START?????

Ok, I picked this up with a Steam coupon.  I thought "75% off, how could I go wrong?" ...... I have since then actually purchased this game AT FULL PRICE to share with my friends, cause WOW.... what a trip down memory lane!!!!

Back in the 1990's we used to hold LAN parties on Friday nights at my place.   I owned a nice little mobile home in town, and so 8 of us would network our computers in various rooms around my house.... I ran Cat5 cable through every single heating duct throughout the house... and we would do Quake or Doom or Dark Forces all-nighters.   

8 guys, killing anything moving.... in cheesy games where the background graphics were soooooo poor (by today's standards) that you couldn't tell if it was a rock or a tree or a barrell.... but oh what fun!!

Now... it's 20+ years later.   All my crew is gone.  Married.... families... one of them moved to another state.... one of them in prison... and me... now I am in Taiwan, half-way around the world.   Those old LAN parties are gone.  The memories fading......

until this beautiful little sniper-shoot comes along.

It's a relatively simple game: Shoot or be shot.   Nothing more.   The RPG is a bit overpowered, but nerfed in that your reload time is actually considered.... The sniper rifle is a beauty.... the machine guns have a serious kick to them....  it really is just plain fun.   While I wish I could creep along in the shadows at times.... nevertheless... this is a great throwback to those days of old.  The AI is pretty consistant, and does manage to kill me often.  (My best game 50 kills, no deaths.  I was on a hot streak I guess)    There are plenty of points for sniping, if you love that (as I do) and the gaming grounds are pretty well thought out.... with some hiding spots if you know what to look for.

Overall --- it's a simple FPS.   But because of the memories I have from all those years back.... this has become one of my favorite STEAM games.   I would rank it right up there with Fallout or Skyrim.

but that's just me.

For the price ... it's a great buy.   The graphics aren't high quality.... but that isn't the point.   I would take this game over CounterStrike any day of the week.

Oh, and there is a global leader board you can get on... nice bonus.

check it out... it really is fun.

review: Where do I even begin? This is perhaps the greatest game I have ever played. The way this game crafts amazing graphics, beautiful world design, and fast paced gameplay is done so well I can't think of another title that comes close to this level of perfection. And the story, just fantastic. Within minutes I had already grown so attached to the characters. Gerard, the main antagonist, is easily the most well created villain of our time. The way the writers can manipulate the player through the story is simply disturbing. And did I mention the graphics? I have spent hours just idly exploring the in game world that they have sculpted, all the while being serenaded by what must be the most masterfully composed soundtrack of all time. This game is a must buy for any gamer. 10/10 would whole heartedly recommend.
